item.title: Teens who use weed before age 15 have more trouble later, a study finds
item.description: Young teens who use cannabis are more likely to be frequent users than people who start later, according to a study in JAMA Network Open. They are als...

item.title: An Alzheimer's pill appears to protect some in a high-risk population
item.description: A new study is reviving hope that a twice-daily pill can slow down Alzheimer's in people whose genes put them at high risk for the disease.

item.title: Schools close and island life is under threat as Greece reckons with low birth rates

item.title: These doctors want to break the cycle of shame and blame in medicine
